TopicTitle: Maximum science from one mission., at start of career. STOCK .23

Articles.Content:
You are at the start of a new career.

Your Program Director is new at this, so he has NO access to any mods. At all. Not even information-only tools. We are talking pure stock, ver 0.23

Science is at ZERO.

Your task is this: Generate the *absolute maximum* of science from one mission.

For the purpose of this challenge, "mission" is defined as sending one craft to the launchpad or runway.

Feel free to do multiple probes, multiple launches, multiple eva's. Might be a bit difficult without any decouplers, etc...

P.S. I would advise against walking to the north pole for a surface sample, but it is quite allowed.

Scoring is total science gathered by the time you start the next mission, i.e. when you would have to send something to the pad or runway again.

As Kelbalnaughts are a scarce resource, your score will be penalized -10% of gross science income for every Kerbal that dies, and -5% for any Kerbal that is alive but stranded away from home.

Feel free to enter as many entries as you like, just please edit any obsolete entry's first line to inform me.

Best so far:

1) MarvinKitFox - Orbital - Type: Orbital survey rocket - 137 science

BunnyHopper II - Type: repeat lander - 72 Science (previous attempts)

Some fuel, some engines. Bottom-mounted capsule for easy access to the ground.

The special patented Absorba-Max girder legs allow high-speed landings, rapid lateral sliding, and even crawls down any slope > 1/15 or so!

So, basically a lander capable of surveying Launchpad, KSC, Runway, shores, grassland, and (when handled by a better pilot that I) water.

Science gathered, when I remembered to do science and not go WHEE,WHOOSH!...... 72 points.
